description:
Rito Yuuki is unlucky when it comes to love — no matter how hard he tries to confess to his crush, his efforts end in failure. After another day’s confession goes down the drain, Rito spends his night sulking in his bathtub. But when a naked girl with a pointed tail teleports into the tub with him, it seems like Rito’s luck is finally looking up! His fortune doesn’t last long when he finds himself accidentally engaged to the buxom beauty who is none other than the princess of the planet Deviluke!

(Source: HIDIVE)
synonyms: วุ่นรักยัยต่างดาว

tags.name: Female Harem
tags.description: Main cast features the protagonist plus several female characters who are romantically interested in them.

tags.name: Slapstick
tags.description: Prominently features comedy based on deliberately clumsy actions or embarrassing events.

tags.name: Surreal Comedy
tags.description: Prominently features comedic moments that defy casual reasoning, resulting in illogical events.

tags.name: Aliens
tags.description: Prominently features extraterrestrial lifeforms.

tags.name: School
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a primary or secondary educational institution.

tags.name: Nudity
tags.description: Features a character wearing no clothing or exposing intimate body parts.

tags.name: Primarily Female Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of female characters.

tags.name: Parody
tags.description: Features deliberate exaggeration of popular tropes or a particular genre to comedic effect.

tags.name: Heterosexual
tags.description: Prominently features a romance between a man and a woman, not inherently sexual.

tags.name: Psychosexual
tags.description: Work that involves the psychological aspects of sexual impulses.

tags.name: Episodic
tags.description: Features story arcs that are loosely tied or lack an overarching plot.

tags.name: Meta
tags.description: Features fourth wall-breaking references to itself or genre tropes.

tags.name: Male Protagonist
tags.description: Main character is male.

tags.name: Tsundere
tags.description: Prominently features a character who acts cold and hostile in order to mask warmer emotions.

tags.name: Primarily Teen Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of teen characters.

tags.name: Ensemble Cast
tags.description: Features a large cast of characters with (almost) equal screen time and importance to the plot.

tags.name: Large Breasts
tags.description: Features a character with larger-than-average breasts.

tags.name: Cohabitation
tags.description: Features two or more people who live in the same household and develop a romantic or sexual relationship.

tags.name: Shounen
tags.description: Target demographic is teenage and young adult males.

tags.name: Monster Girl
tags.description: Prominently features a female character who is part-monster.

tags.name: Kuudere
tags.description: Prominently features a character who generally retains a cold, blunt and cynical exterior, but once one gets to know them, they have a very warm and loving interior.

tags.name: Ghost
tags.description: Prominently features a character who is a ghost.

tags.name: Gender Bending
tags.description: Prominently features a character who dresses and behaves in a way characteristic of another gender, or has been transformed into a person of another gender.

name.native: ララ・サタリン・デビルーク
ルン・エルシ・ジュエリア
レン・エルシ・ジュエリア

node.description:
[Profile (StarCrew)](https://www.starcrew.co.jp/talent/misatofukuen/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/misa0110) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/misato_fukuen/)

**Non-Anime Roles**:
• Sushang (Honkai Series)
• Hopper1 (Kamen Rider Gotchard)
• Eupha (Metaphor: ReFantazio)
• Natsume Iroha (Blue Archive)

[Blog](http://ameblo.jp/chiemi2-25/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/ChiemiChiba)

A voice actress, singer, and former gravure model. Made her singing debut on April 7, 1993 as a member of the J-Pop group Aurora Gonin Musume. She is currently affiliated with Ken Production.

__Height:__ 165 cm

[Website](https://www.tomatsuharuka.com/) | [Blog](http://ameblo.jp/tomatsuharuka-blog)

Tomatsu debuted in 2007, starring in Shinkyoku Soukai Polyphonica as Corticarte Apa Lagranges. Since then, she has had other major roles such as Lala Satalin Deviluke in To Love-Ru and Shiho Sannomiya in Zettai Karen Children. Before graduating from high school in 2008, she used to live in Ichimomiya city where she often took the shinkansen, traveling back and forth between Nagoya and Tokyo to attend recordings. On January 11, 2019, she married a man from outside the entertainment industry.

One of the members of the voice actress unit [Sphere](https://anilist.co/staff/103636).

__Non-anime roles:__
- Mary - Goddess of Victory: Nikke (VG)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/yabuki_info)

A Japanese manga artist. His mentor was Takeshi Obata, the illustrator of Death Note, Hikaru no Go, Bakuman and Platinum End. The mangaka [Shinohara Kenta](https://anilist.co/staff/97994/Shinohara-Kenta) is his brother-in-law.

Yabuki is best known for his series Black Cat, which ran from 2000 to 2004 in Weekly Shounen Jump and later adapted into an anime. Upon its ending, Yabuki expressed desire to make a sequel from the series, or make its characters reappear in another work. From 2004 to 2020, he only worked as illustrator to works written by other authors, most notably on To Love-Ru alongside his former assistant Saki Hasemi. That was until the release of Ayakashi Triangle on the pages of Shounen Jump in 2020.
Affiliated with [C-Station](https://anilist.co/studio/6074/CStation).
[Website](http://takeshiwatanabe.com/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/VOTOM_Watanabe) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/渡辺剛_(キーボーディスト))
Racehorse owner and son of the late [Atsushi Yamatoya](https://anilist.co/staff/200012).

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/加戸誉夫)

Currently part of [Studio Mother](https://anilist.co/studio/6638/). Former long-time member of [Xebec](https://anilist.co/studio/27/). Originally from [Ashi Productions](https://anilist.co/studio/196/), which he joined after graduating from Osaka University of Arts in 1985.

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/加戸誉夫)

Currently part of [Studio Mother](https://anilist.co/studio/6638/). Former long-time member of [Xebec](https://anilist.co/studio/27/). Originally from [Ashi Productions](https://anilist.co/studio/196/), which he joined after graduating from Osaka University of Arts in 1985.
[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/太田雅彦)

__Members:__
• thyme / Sayaka Kamiyama (神山さやか) — lyrics, vocals
• [Teppei Shimizu](https://anilist.co/staff/159601) (清水哲平) — arrangement, composition, guitar
• Takafumi Hoshino (星野孝文) — arrangement, engineering, lyrics

Thyme was a Japanese pop rock band. Originally, it was a solo project by the female singer Thyme, who had previously released three singles in 2002 as Sayaka Kamiyama. Kamiyama started collaborating with sound engineer Teppei Shimizu in July 2004, and changed her name to Thyme in June 2005. In December 2005, Thyme (the singer) and Shimizu formed the duo "Thyme" (the singer's name is normally stylized as "thyme" for distinction). In July 2006, Takafumi Hoshino officially joined and Thyme became a three-piece band. 

They had their major debut in September 2007 with their first official single "Hello". Thyme released their second single "Forever We Can Make It!" in April 2008; the title song was used as the opening theme to the anime series [To Love-Ru](https://anilist.co/anime/3455/). Thyme released their third single "Fly Away" on August 6, 2008, which had the title song used as the opening to the anime [Mahou Tsukai ni Taisetsu na Koto: Natsu no Sora](https://anilist.co/anime/4483/). Thyme released their first (and only) album First 9uality on September 3, 2008. On September 23, 2010, the band officially announced they have broken up, and Thyme (the singer) restarted her solo singing career.

(Source: Wikipedia)

__Members:__
• thyme / Sayaka Kamiyama (神山さやか) — lyrics, vocals
• [Teppei Shimizu](https://anilist.co/staff/159601) (清水哲平) — arrangement, composition, guitar
• Takafumi Hoshino (星野孝文) — arrangement, engineering, lyrics

[Blog](http://aminon.asablo.jp/blog/) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E3%82%A2%E3%83%9F%E3%83%8E%E3%83%86%E3%83%84%E3%83%AD%E3%83%BC) | [Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tetsur%C5%8D_Amino)

Tetsurou Amino is a Japanese director, screenwriter and storyboard artist.

In 1988, he started using his name in katakana.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/gennjousannzou)

Originating from [Toei Animation](https://anilist.co/studio/18/). Freelance since 2001.
Saki Hasemi is a Japanese anime scripter and manga writer, best known for authoring the manga series To Love Ru and To Love Ru Darkness alongside illustrator Kentaro Yabuki.
Formerly affiliated with [Xebec](https://anilist.co/studio/27/).
Formerly affiliated with [Xebec](https://anilist.co/studio/27/).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/johnsama) | [Pixiv](https://www.pixiv.net/en/users/75255)

Noted for his work in the [Sword Art Online](https://anilist.co/anime/11757/) franchise.

Married to fellow animator [Haruko Iizuka](https://anilist.co/staff/105678/).
[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/西森章)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/299563377) | [Website](https://skeb.jp/@oka_yu_1)

Affiliated with [CloverWorks](https://anilist.co/studio/6222/), where he's currently focused in training young animators.
